HUN. MR. BROWN —The hon. gentleman is mistaken. The Hon. Attorney General West distinctly stated to-day that there was an error in the telegraphic report of the debate in the Imperial Parliament, and it is highly indecorous for the hon. gentleman to repeat these statements after they have been shown to be erroneous. And 1 am now in a position to ‘state, that we have had an answer to a telegram sent specially to New York to ascertain the fact from the London papers, that the sum asked for by the Impe- rial Government for the defences of Quebec was £200,000, not £50,000 as stated by the hon. member.

Ma. _ SCATCHERD—Before the hon- member makes charges, he ought to have ascertained that this telegram had been brought to my notice. I took the statement as it appeared in the published telegraph" reports. He has no right to charge me with repeating an incorrect statement. (Hear, hear.)
